WRITING.TITLE: Good drawback for a powerful magic sword? [5e]
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m the DM for a campaign right now and have decided that it #8217;s about time for the party to start getting some cool new weapons so they #8217;ll be better equipped to handle the enemies I plan to throw at them later. One weapon is an enchanted greatsword that does 2d6 + 3 slashing damage and can also release an energy wave that does an additional d12 of damage if the attack roll was a 17 or higher (without modifiers). Naturally, a weapon this cool needs some drawbacks. So aside from needing a certain strength level to wield it, what are some negative aspects I can add to the sword to make it a little more problematic/harmful to the person using it?
It #8217;s probably going to end up with the barbarian or the paladin. Most other members in the party prefer lighter weapons.

So when the goblin makes an attack, you roll the d20. That #8217;s called the attack roll. You then add 4 to the d20 because the goblin has a +4 modifier. So say you rolled a 12, you add the 4, and the final number is 16. You then compare the attack roll to the player #8217;s armor class (AC). If the attack roll is HIGHER than the armor class, the attack hits. If the attack roll is LOWER than the armor class, then the attack does not hit. If the attack hits, you roll the damage die. In this case, the attack die is 1d6+2. So you just roll the d6 and add 2 to the result. That number is how many hit points the player takes in damage. You do the same process when a player attacks another character. Hope I was able to help and best of luck with your campaign!

I can #8217;t say that I #8217;ve gone through your exact experience, but my biological father behaved in a very similar way and did a lot of the same things that you #8217;re saying to me, my brothers, and my mom. I hated him for it and like you, i was feeling suicidal and eventually ran away to live with my mom and cut ties with my father. My brothers didn #8217;t make the same choice, they stayed, and I know how hard it is to watch your siblings get hurt for your actions. It sucks. But it does start to get better. Something that I had to learn was that it #8217;s okay to prioritize yourself over other people. After all, if you can #8217;t take care of yourself, you can #8217;t be expected to take care of others. So do yourself a favor and choose what #8217;s best for you, not for your siblings. Then, once you #8217;re stable, offer support and encouragement to the people that you love. Let them know that you love them, but that you refuse to be around an abusive and toxic person like your father. You deserve better than that. So do all your siblings and so does your mother. I know it might not mean much coming from a stranger on the internet, but I do hope to God that things turn out well for you and your entire family.

It would only be cultural appropriation if you are claiming to be the original creator of that culture. As long as you give credit where credit is due, it should not be a problem. Take for example Avatar: the Last Airbender. Each individual nation was based off of Chinese (Earth), Japanese (Fire), Tibetan (Air), and Native American (Water) cultures. But, the show was created by white Americans. The creators presented the various cultures in their fantasy world in a very respectful way. As long as you do the same, I wouldn #8217;t be worried.

When I was 16 I was driving through some mountains and a hail storm suddenly set it. Even though I was going a safe speed, it was still pretty dangerous and hard to see/control the truck. I came around one bend and saw a massive mudslide going across the road and over a cliff. I hit the breaks but the truck started to hydroplane forward and I couldn #8217;t stop. Going right meant crashing into the mountain. Going left meant going off the cliff. Going straight would mean the mudslide dragged me over the edge. All I could do is close my eyes and panic. When I opened them, my truck was on the other side of the mudslide without any kind of damage. I didn #8217;t feel any kind of a bump or anything when I went over the mud and have no idea how I made it out alive. I decided that it had to have been an act of God because I can #8217;t come up with any other logical explanation.
Sounds like home, so I #8217;m going to say Texas.

When I was 5, I was madly in love with my 16 year old babysitter, Lacy. My older brother who was 8 at the time knew about it and was going to tell her, so I hit him in the head with a giant stick I found in the back yard. He was unhappy about that. So he found an equally large stick and hit me back. 20 minutes later, we #8217;re rolling around in the yard, beating the hell out of each other while our poor babysitter can #8217;t do anything to really stop us, for fear of also being hit with a stick. Meanwhile, our other brother (age 7) is just watching us go at it while eating Scooby Doo fruit snacks on the back porch. That #8217;s about when our parents got home and broke everything up. When they asked us what the hell was going on, my oldest brother pointed at me and blurred out #8220;HE DOESN #8217;T WANT LACY TO KNOW HE LOVES HER! #8221; So I hit him again. It #8217;s one of my earliest memories.

WRITING.TITLE: ASMR videos are not only stupid, they #8217;re creepy and uncomfortable.
WRITING.TEXT: Seriously, if I wanted to get chills down my spine and listen to someone whisper weird shit in my ear, I would spend the night at my uncle #8217;s house. Just because it #8220;kinda sorta maybe #8221; sounds like the sounds are coming from all around you doesn #8217;t make it relaxing or comfortable. And unless the device you #8217;re listening through has surround sound, the sound isn #8217;t actually doing that. It #8217;s a total placebo effect. Tapping on shit with finger nails, clicking pens, rubbing coins together, etc. are typically associated with UNCOMFORTABLE and ANNOYING sounds! So why is in when an attractive girl does it on camera with fancy sound equipment, it #8217;s considered cool and relaxing? The emphasis on the syllables is an unnatural way of speaking that makes the person behind the mic sound alien and strange, like your listening to a fake human try to pretend to be a human. And the way they pronounce the S in every word that has an S makes them sound like Herbert the Pervert from Family Guy. And listening to them inhale and exhale over and over and over and over again through the video is incredibly annoying. Not to mention how weirdly expressive they are with their hands. Possibly the WORST PART about ASMR videos though is that God awful, wet smacking sound that the mic picks up when someone speaks. I #8217;m talking about that disgusting, wet #8220;teecck #8221; noise. The noise that sounds like a baby trying to chew apple sauce with its mouth open for the first time. If you #8217;re into ASMR, cool. Don #8217;t let me stop you from enjoying the shit that you love. Maybe I just don #8217;t see the appeal or I #8217;m wired differently. But I find that shit to be absolutely repulsive.

WRITING.TITLE: Young kids and teenagers enjoying Fortnite is normal. And if you make kids feel bad about being interest in things that you aren #8217;t interested in, then you #8217;re an asshole and an old fart.
WRITING.TEXT: Yeah, Fortnite can be pretty annoying and the dances are stupid. Who gives a shit? Kids like stupid shit! They always have and they always will! When I was a kid, I had an asshole old man as my next door neighbor. I #8217;m talking about a real Mr. Scrooge. The kind of guy who would find my football in his backyard, stab it with a steak knife, then throw it back over the fence. The kind of guy who would yell at me and my brothers for riding our bikes in the street. A real puppy kicker. That dude was a dick and we all hated him because we were just trying to have fun! It #8217;s not our fault that our version of fun is different from his. Today, I try my best to avoid being like that asshole. Yeah, kids are fucking annoying. Who gives a shit? It #8217;s not like a viral video of some kid #8220;flossing #8221; is bringing you personal harm or inconveniencing your life in any way, shape, or form. And it #8217;s not like we were any better. Don #8217;t you people remember those super cringy Minecraft parody song videos? We ate that shit up as kids! And now that we #8217;re adults, we #8217;ve grown out of it. So chill the fuck out and let kids be kids. They #8217;re stupid and goofy because they don #8217;t have to deal with shit in the real world yet. And I think that #8217;s a good thing. Let them enjoy their video games. When a kid throws a ball in your yard, toss it back over the fence. When you see a video of a Fortnite dance, roll your eyes and skip it. Don #8217;t be the asshole old man/woman who lives next door. Be the cool old man/woman who makes some bomb ass lemonade for the neighborhood kids.

When I was 16, I was homeless because I fled an abusive father. Had it not been for the kindness of strangers, I would have died. Most of the other homeless people I met had severe mental disabilities and many were vets. There is no way to distinguish a #8220;regular #8221; homeless person from a homeless vet and adding the qualifier #8220;unless they served in the US military #8221; is just a bullshit excuse to make yourself feel better about your elitist lack of empathy for other human beings. A person #8217;s worth shouldn #8217;t be measured by how much money they have or how many resources they can produce. Claiming so is disgusting.
Nah man. I don #8217;t give a single fuck about the game itself. I #8217;m talking about all the hate that people put on little kids for enjoying it.

WRITING.TITLE: Fuck SC Johnson. They are NOT a family company.
WRITING.TEXT: TL;DR - SC Johnson is not a family company, they #8217;re a multi billion dollar enterprise that happens to pass from father to son. They present themselves as a family company to trick the hardworking American consumer into buying their products and thinking they #8217;re supporting a deserving family. The family is not deserving of that kind of sympathy. I don #8217;t really know if this opinion is unpopular or if it #8217;s just something that no one notices/talks about. All I know is then when I get drunk and start ranting about this shit, no one seems to agree with me. So I #8217;m going to rant about it while sober to a bunch of strangers on the internet instead. After every fucking commercial for a SC Johnson product, they do that little tug of the corner of the screen to reveal the logo and that pleasant sounding woman says their slogan. #8220;SC Johnson! A family company! #8221; That #8217;s such fucking bullshit and it infuriates me to no end. SCJ is a massive fucking corporation that has a net value of $28.8 billion and sell approximately $10 billion worth of product every year. That puts the Johnson family as the 9th wealthiest family in the entire fucking United States of America (according to Forbes, at least.) The company operates across 70 different nations in order to gain cheap labor and sells products in basically every country in the world. THEY ARE GLOBAL. Yet they still love to sit back and say that they #8217;re a family company! They employ roughly 13,000 people. And that doesn #8217;t include the manufacturers of the products, which they outsource for. Speaking of products, SCJ manufactures dozens of products! Ones such as Shout, Babyganics, Windex, Mr. Muscle, Kit, Baygon, Bayclin, Ziploc, Glade, Brise, Kiwi, Raid, OFF!, Kabikiller, Pledge, Scrubbing Bubbles, Caldrea, Mrs. Meyer's Clean Day, Drano, Toilet Duck, Fantastik, Autan, and Saran! That #8217;s basically every #8220;name brand #8221; cleaning supply found in every American household! #8220;Well yeah, but the company is owned by Fisk Johnson! The fifth generation to own it! #8221; You say? #8220;Who gives a fuck? #8221; I answer. Yeah, the company has been passed from father to son for 5 generations. That doesn #8217;t mean it #8217;s a family company. Perhaps it was a family company when it first started in 1886, with a single man and a few employees trying to make something for themselves. But today? Not a fucking chance. A family company would be the local arts and crafts store that #8217;s run by an elderly couple who sits behind the desk and interacts with their customers on a daily basis. A family company is NOT a multi billion dollar, multinational powerhouse enterprise! SC Johnson passing from father to son doesn #8217;t make it a family company - it makes it a fucking dynasty. And speaking of Fisk Johnson, the SCJ website give you a [whole ass biography](https://www.scjohnson.com/en/a-family-company/the-johnson-family/fisk-johnson-current-chairman-and-ceo-of-sc-johnson-champions-innovation-and-transparency) of the man! They give you 7 paragraphs where they talk about his qualifications, accomplishments, and awards, then throw in a single sentence where they say #8220;Fisk is a devoted father who enjoys spending a great deal of time with his daughter. #8221; Only to then drop the subject of his family entirely and let you know that he has hobbies such as SCUBA diving and skiing! Woo! Yeah, he really seems like a family man to me! I should probably add that the website also has the words #8220;family company #8221; written all over it. And I mean that literally - they say #8220;family company #8221; every fucking chance they get. They are constantly shoving those words down the throats of their customers and it #8217;s disgusting. They #8217;re trying to masquerade as an actual family company, passing themselves off as #8220;a little ol #8217; Ma and Pop kind of place that could really use your help! Think of our kids! #8221; When that #8217;s an outright lie. They spit in the face of ACTUAL family companies and small business everywhere! They #8217;re trying to gain the sympathy and trust that comes with real family companies while operating as a corporation, and that is a bold faced lie! In conclusion, fuck SC Johnson.
No, fuck this company because they lie about what they are. If they didn #8217;t aggressively portray themselves as a family company, then they #8217;d only be as bad as a regular corporation.

I #8217;m fine with that, but only on the condition that all other extra curricular activities are also payed. And the law should enforce that level of equality. There #8217;s nothing wrong with being proud of your heritage. I take pride in my Greek roots because the Greeks were pretty cool in my opinion. However, taking pride in being white means you take pride in having a position of privilege over people who are not white. Meanwhile, it #8217;s okay to be proud of being black because of two reasons. 1) Being black doesn #8217;t inherently put you in a position of privilege. And 2) When white men brought slaves across the Atlantic, the slaves were cut off from their countries of origin. Therefore, many black people cant trace their roots back to a specific country. They can #8217;t say #8220;I #8217;m Kenyan #8221; or #8220;I #8217;m Ethiopian. #8221; Instead, all they can say is #8220;I #8217;m black #8221; or #8220;I #8217;m African. #8221; No one is upset with you for being proud or interested in your heritage. It #8217;s fine to be proud of being English, Irish, Scottish, French, German, Italian, or whatever. But again, taking pride in being WHITE means you #8217;re proud that you #8217;re NOT BLACK. And that #8217;s a rather shitty thing to be proud of.

You #8217;re argument is rooted in the assumption that self preservation isn #8217;t natural. I disagree with that. The act of preserving one #8217;s self is a knee jerk reaction and 100% natural - that #8217;s why we violently pull away from painful stimuli like a hot stove. It takes a great deal of willpower to override that natural instinct. Or, it takes a severe mental illness to override that instinct. Just because someone claims that they want to kill them self doesn #8217;t mean that #8217;s necessarily true. It #8217;s more accurate to say that they want to stop being in pain. (Which goes back to the self preservation instinct.) Therefore, a person who #8217;s contemplating suicide shouldn #8217;t just do so. Instead, they should seek ways to overcome the mental illness and end the pain that they #8217;re experiencing in a healthy way.

So I #8217;ve got some pretty deeply rooted issues. Neglectful and abusive parents. Brothers tried to kill me once or twice. Ran away from home and loved on the streets for a while. Blah blah blah. That #8217;s all behind me and with years of therapy and self help, I #8217;ve processed most of it. But the one bitch I can #8217;t fucking stand was my 6th grade computer teacher, whom I #8217;ll call Coach W. So Coach W was the dumbest asshat I #8217;ve ever met in my entire fucking life, and believe me when I say I #8217;ve met some dumb fucking people. She once accused the entire grade of commuting plagiarism on the same assignment. Just in case I #8217;m being unclear, she accused EVERY 6th GRADER IN THE SCHOOL OF THE SAME CRIME ON THE SAME PAPER AT THE SAME TIME. Because she #8220;Knows how 6th graders write, and that #8217;s not how! #8221; Was there any other proof? Nope! Did she put any paper in a plagiarism checker? Of course not! She just knew. Because apparently she #8217;s an all knowing goddess! She had this rule where you had to be logged in to you computer before class started. Which wasn #8217;t that big of a deal at first, but she also had a no tolerance policy if you weren #8217;t. And so, if you weren #8217;t logged in before the bell rang, you were sent to the principle #8217;s office for #8220;failure to follow basic instructions. #8221; The problem is that 6th graders are all assholes, so there was a big problem with the kid next to you always hitting escape as you were trying to log in, resulting in probably about 3 or 4 students being sent to the office every class period. And don #8217;t even bother trying to explain that someone else was fucking with your keyboard, because that would only result in her adding #8220;delaying/disrupting class #8221; to your list of crimes. She was also exceptionally disorganized. We would have to print off assignments and turn them in, she #8217;d grade them, then return them. But, she wouldn #8217;t enter them into the grade book online, resulting in you having a failing grade in the class. If you went to Coach W about this problem, she would say, #8220;My grading system is perfect, I wouldn #8217;t make a mistake like that. #8221; So naturally, I started saving all my graded assignments to show her when she said that. Her response? #8220;You didn #8217;t actually turn that in. You just printed that off today and wrote a grade on it. #8221; Funny, right? So I started asking her to sign the graded papers as well. So that she couldn #8217;t say that anymore. And know what that bitch had to say to that? #8220;You forged my signature! How dare you? Go to the office right now! #8221; I consider myself to be a very forgiving and easy going person. But holy fucking shit. That woman was the bane of my 6th grade existence and brought me more trouble than she could possibly fathom and for that reason, she can rot in Hell. I could go into more detail, but I don #8217;t really feel like writing an novel right now.

WRITING.TITLE: Internet trolling is a lost art
WRITING.TEXT: Trolling used to be about provoking someone into an internet fight or causing them to become irrationally upset. These days, trolls have lost their flair. There #8217;s no shock factor anymore. The modern troll simply finds whatever is a hot topic and then posts the inverse opinion (in a forum that isn #8217;t r/unpopularopinion I mean). #8220;Feminism is trash! #8221; #8220;Lolz, I #8217;m racist! #8221; #8220;Suicide is totally fine, it #8217;s their life! #8221; Please, that #8217;s boring as fuck. We #8217;ve all seen that before. You #8217;re not a troll, you #8217;re just a glorified asshole with access to the internet. Trolls no longer care about their work. They #8217;re lazy, and so they #8217;re no longer entertaining. Get new material.

That distance wouldn #8217;t really have much of an impact. Contrary to popular belief, the distance of the sun to the earth doesn #8217;t really affect temperature too much - presently at least. Instead, it #8217;s the angle at which the earth is tilted that causes the north hemisphere to get more direct sunlight in the summer and less in the winter. The earth is actually significantly closer to the sun during the winter and farther away during the summer.

So now, if everyone assumes that about all homeless people, how do you expect them to actually start contributing to society through work? They can #8217;t because no one will actually hire those individuals. Next, let #8217;s look at the actual statistical facts. According to a study done by the US Department of Housing and Urban Development Which can be found [here](https://www.bbrfoundation.org/blog/homelessness-and-mental-illness-challenge-our-society), 25% of the homeless population suffers from a serious mental illness. 45% have any mental illness. This comes at a MASSIVE contrast to the rest of the US population which only has 4.2% of adults with a serious mental illness. Just to make sure that we all know what I mean when I say #8220;mental illness, #8221; I #8217;m using the definitions provided by [the National Institute of Mental Health.](https://www.nimh.nih.gov/health/statistics/mental-illness.shtml) Any Mental Illness (AMI) is defined as #8220;mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder. AMI can vary in impact, ranging from no impairment to mild, moderate, and even severe impairment (e.g., individuals with serious mental illness. #8221; Serious Mental Illness (SMI) is defined as a mental, behavioral, or emotional disorder resulting in serious functional impairment, which substantially interferes with or limits one or more major life activities. The burden of mental illnesses is particularly concentrated among those who experience disability due to SMI. That means that a good portion of the homeless population that you condemned as useless bums literally cannot function in society without help. Let #8217;s also not forget that a good portion of the homeless population is made up of veterans who served in the US military. I can #8217;t find a good source that give me exact percentages, but according to [this source](https://endhomelessness.org/resource/veteran-homelessness/) there are almost 39,500 homeless vets on the street today, people who DID contribute to their society and made the ultimate sacrifice, only to come back to people like you saying they don #8217;t deserve sympathy. In conclusion, your arguments are factually flawed and grossly insensitive at a basic human compassion level. Don #8217;t think of these people as #8220;bums who got there by their own choice. #8221; Because most of them aren #8217;t. Think of them as people who are struggling to live their lives. Either help or get out of the fucking way of people who are trying to help the HOMELESS population. Oh, and according to the [United Nations Human Rights Council](https://www.un.org/en/universal-declaration-human-rights/) housing is a HUMAN RIGHT, as per article 25. So your argument otherwise is a literal crime against humanity.

Yes. Because this one fictional book that #8217;s at an 8th grade reading level is the ONLY possible way to ever implement a utopian society.

My problem isn #8217;t with your conclusion. My issue is with how you arrived at your conclusion and what you plan to do with that conclusion. First and foremost, you use a fictional book as your source to describe all human nature, which isn #8217;t really valid. Reason through those things and arrive at your own conclusions. Don #8217;t take a fictional story as historical fact. The author can #8217;t see the future. Second, you take a pessimistic, #8220;give up #8221; kind of stance with your conclusion. As if to say #8220;We #8217;ll never reach a utopia, so why try? #8221; And that #8217;s the very essence of a dystopia - living in a society where you have no hope of improving it. I don #8217;t personally believe that we #8217;ll ever reach a utopia, but we should always strive for perfection, even knowing that we #8217;ll never reach it. The best way I can describe it is with Aristotle #8217;s explanation of the purpose of an acorn. The reason that acorns exist is to grow into the strongest oak tree that they possibly can, even though it will never become a #8220;perfect #8221; tree. The acorn doesn #8217;t know how strong of a tree it will become, all it knows is that it needs to grow as much as possible. Likewise, humans and human society should do the same. We know that we will never reach perfection, but we must always try to reach that perfection.

Your conclusions are predicated off of an assumption that what we #8217;ve seen of humans is part of their nature, thus opening the #8220;nature vs nurture #8221; debate. I #8217;m not about to get into that, I #8217;m just going to point out that NO ONE truly knows what human nature is. Your next mistake is arguing that any time we approach a utopia, we inevitably enter a dystopia. You have no evidence to support this because, as you said, we #8217;ve never seen a utopian society in human history. That #8217;s faulty logic. You #8217;re essentially saying #8220;We #8217;ve never gotten close to a utopia because when we do get close to one, we enter a dystopia. #8221; To translate that statement, you #8217;re claiming that we have NEVER gotten close to a utopia, but every time we HAVE gotten close, we failed. So which is it? Have we never gotten close? Or do we fail every time that we do get close? Third, once again, I agree that perfection is an impossible concept to achieve. But that doesn #8217;t mean that we should stop trying. Humans always have and always will seek to improve their own lives, and therefore, the lives of those around them. That fact has been observed throughout all of human history. And if this shit that we #8217;re currently in is the best we can do - as you claim - then human society is fucked. We literally have people in the streets starving to death. Unarmed children getting killed by police. Racial and sexual inequality. Poverty. War. Famine. Disease. All of these problems exist here and now. Today. They #8217;re literally happening as I type this message. And you really think that we should call it quits here? Hell no. That #8217;s unacceptable. As long as there #8217;s suffering in this world, there will be those fighting to make things better. Get with the program or get left behind.

When I (21 M) was about 3, my parents ended up getting divorced which wasn #8217;t really that big of a deal. What did stand out to me was that my new baby brother was born later that year. By the time I was about 5 or 6, I realized that my father had cheated on my mother with the woman who would later become my stepmother. After that, I went from being an only child to having two older step brothers and one new half brother in a very short amount of time. My new stepmom was a bit of a bitch who was constantly playing mind games and just outright never liked me. One thing that she would do often would be to mention things I #8217;d done in the past and gotten in trouble for any time one of my brothers was in trouble for anything. That redirected my father #8217;s anger from my brothers to me and I would end up getting #8220;punished #8221; again for something that happened several months before. Of course, #8220;punishments #8221; made no logical sense and were just violent displays of physical power by my father. Excuses to beat his children. For example, I was once beat with a belt in a parking lot when I was about 7 because my aunt hugged me at a family reunion and #8220;Men don #8217;t show affection like that! People might think you #8217;re a little faggot! #8221; There was also quite a bit of neglect. My brothers and I started having to pay for our own school lunches around the age of 10 or so, which meant saving up as much birthday money as we could and hoping we could make it last all year, then selling toys and working wherever a 10 year old could when we inevitably ran out of money. We #8217;d often go without things like soap and tooth paste for months before we got more. Either one of those could have been fixed by either parent getting a job. But my father was a self described entrepreneur (which basically meant he was a con artist) and my stepmother was his secretary (which basically meant that she didn #8217;t do shit.) My oldest stepbrother certainly didn #8217;t help the situation. Because he was often abused as well, he would turn around and take his frustrations out on me. At one point, he tied a rope around my neck and tried to hang me from a tree. Thankfully, he wasn #8217;t very good at tying knots. Standing up to him didn #8217;t do much because he was a good four years older than me. And telling my parents didn #8217;t do anything because they #8217;d simply respond by saying #8220;Boys will be boys #8221; or #8220;You #8217;ve got to learn to man up and deal with shit yourself. #8221; As I got older, the abuse didn #8217;t really slow down but it did get a bit more psychological in nature. My father and stepmother would often gaslight me to make me doubt my own sanity. They #8217;d constantly berate and insult my interests and hobbies. They didn #8217;t support me in any of my aspirations, no matter how big or small. They isolated me from my biological mom and constantly tried to convince me that she was some kind of evil bitch. They made their financial problems into my problem. So on and so forth, and the physical abuse continued as well. Eventually, when I was about 16, I finally took my father #8217;s #8220;man up #8221; mentality to heart and when he came at me, I fought back with everything I had and beat the living hell out of him. After that, I ran away from home and found my way to my biological mom #8217;s place where I got the appropriate kind of help to deal with the years of trauma that I #8217;d suffered and I #8217;m happy to say that I #8217;m doing much better now than I was before. I #8217;m pretty well adjusted already and slowly getting better, too. So there #8217;s my abridged story.

The Greek word for the host-guest relationship is #8220;xenia. #8221; It was widely known through all of the Mediterranean world and most cultures had some form of it. In almost every story involving the relationship, the offenders are struck with blindness followed by death, which is USUALLY enforced by the #8220;father god #8221; of that culture - which is exactly what happens to the men in the story of Sodom and Gomorrah. Another prime example of this is the story of Odysseus and the cyclops Polyphemus. In it, Odysseus assumes the role of guest in Polyphemus #8217; home (which was perfectly acceptable and not uncommon in that time) only to have Polyphemus violate the hospitality by killing one of Odysseus #8217; men and threatening to eat the rest. Odysseus retaliates by stabbing the cyclops in the eye and later killing him. This completely aligns with the rules of xenia - there #8217;s a violation, then blindness, and finally death. The same thing happens in both the story of Sodom and Gomorrah as well as Odysseus and Polyphemus.

WRITING.TITLE: The Signs Were All There
WRITING.TEXT: So for most of my life, I #8217;ve done finger guns after making shitty puns - after snapping, of course. I #8217;ve also always liked lemon bars and cuff my jeans on occasion. I joined this sub about twenty minutes ago and apparently all of those things are all super bisexual?? If I #8217;d known that before, I probably would have realized I was bi years ago. Edit: Also just learned that cool and/or leather jackets are also a bi thing. So rad.

Hey! So I #8217;m also a Christian and also very bisexual. It was something that I struggled with for quite a while and didn #8217;t become comfortable with until I became more educated in scripture and the culture of the time it was written. It #8217;s real easy to look at certain aspects of the Bible and assume that we understand the message clearly, when in all actuality, we don #8217;t get it at all. TL;DR - Don #8217;t take everything at face value. Just because your preacher says #8220;The Bible says gays go to hell! #8221; Doesn #8217;t mean it #8217;s true. Read it for yourself and research the REAL meaning. Also, Sodom and Gomorrah have LITERALLY NOTHING TO DO WITH GAY SEX! Now this is going to be a little bit long winded, but just follow me for a second. The word #8220;Xenia #8221; is found in ancient Greek. It basically means #8220;hospitality #8221; but in a VERY specific way. It #8217;s a concept that was consistent throughout the entire Mediterranean region. Basically, the rules of xenia are that if a traveler appears on your doorstep and asks to stay the night, you MUST take them in. Once they #8217;re in your home, you have to feed the traveler, offer them a bath, and protect them from any and all harm that might come to them. Only after you have done all of those things are you even allowed to ask their name. Once the guest leaves, the host is to provide them with a gift. Meanwhile, the guest is to do no harm to the host and provide them a gift as they leave. The Greeks (and other mediterranean cultures) took this concept VERY seriously for two reasons. 1) Traveling alone at night was exceptionally dangerous. It was basically a surefire way to die. 2) It was believed that God (or #8220;the gods #8221;) would often times travel to Earth and test human hospitality. If you failed, you were punished by being struck blind and then killed. Xenia was so important in Mediterranean life that there #8217;s a passage in The Iliad where two soldiers meet each other on the battle field and one says to the other #8220;My great grandfather spent a night in the home of your great grandfather! I refuse to fight a guest! #8221; And then they both turn around and refuse to take up arms against one another. So just to recap the rules of xenia - God will sometimes travel to Earth to test humans. You have to accept a stranger into your house for the night. You have to provide them food and a bath. You have to protect them from all harm. The guest can #8217;t harm the host. Both parties must exchange gifts. If you don #8217;t obey, God will strike you with blindness and death. Now, that we know a little bit about the culture of the Mediterranean, let #8217;s look at possibly the MOST anti-homosexuality story in the Bible. The story of Sodom and Gomorrah. The summarized version is this - God sends his angels to Sodom and Gomorrah to see if there are any non-wicked people. Lot meets them and offers to let them stay in his home. They refuse and say they #8217;ll stay outside, but Lot insists. So, the angels oblige him and accept his offer. Later that night, the men of the city come and demand to have sex with the angels. Lot refuses, the men force their way into his home, and then the city is destroyed as a result. Now, for more detail. Genesis 18: 20-21 Then the Lord said, #8220;The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is so great and their sin so grievous that I will go down and see if what they have done is as bad as the outcry that has reached me. If not, I will know. #8221; - Here, we see the first rule. God coming to Earth (or in this case, sending His angels) and testing mankind. Genesis 19: 1-13 The two angels arrived at Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gateway of the city. When he saw them, he got up to meet them and bowed down with his face to the ground. #8220;My lords, #8221; he said, #8220;please turn aside to your servant #8217;s house. You can wash your feet and spend the night and then go on your way early in the morning. #8221; #8220;No, #8221; they answered, #8220;we will spend the night in the square. #8221; But he insisted so strongly that they did go with him and entered his house. He prepared a meal for them, baking bread without yeast, and they ate. Before they had gone to bed, all the men from every part of the city of Sodom #8212;both young and old #8212;surrounded the house. They called to Lot, #8220;Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us so that we can have sex with them. #8221; Lot went outside to meet them and shut the door behind him and said, #8220;No, my friends. Don #8217;t do this wicked thing. Look, I have two daughters who have never slept with a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you can do what you like with them. But don #8217;t do anything to these men, for they have come under the protection of my roof. #8221; #8220;Get out of our way, #8221; they replied. #8220;This fellow came here as a foreigner, and now he wants to play the judge! We #8217;ll treat you worse than them. #8221; They kept bringing pressure on Lot and moved forward to break down the door. But the men inside reached out and pulled Lot back into the house and shut the door. Then they struck the men who were at the door of the house, young and old, with blindness so that they could not find the door. The two men said to Lot, #8220;Do you have anyone else here #8212;sons-in-law, sons or daughters, or anyone else in the city who belongs to you? Get them out of here, because we are going to destroy this place. The outcry to the Lord against its people is so great that he has sent us to destroy it. #8221; - Here, we see almost every other rule of xenia. Lot first offers his house and tells the angels that they may wash their feet (shelter from the night and a bath.) Second, he prepares them a meal and allows them to eat. Third, he seeks to protect them from harm (the harm being the men outside). He even goes so far as to offer up his daughters instead and then says #8220;They have come under the protection of my roof. #8221; Notice that phrase - he doesn #8217;t say #8220;gay sex is bad. #8221; He #8217;s basically saying #8220;these men are my guests and I want to keep them safe. #8221; The men of the city call the angels foreigners, showing that they have no regard for guests and continue to try to rape the angels. Then, the men are struck blind (the first part of the punishment) and later, they #8217;re killed when the city is destroyed (the second part of the punishment.) So now, with a bit of context in the culture, the passage is suddenly not about gay sex at all. It #8217;s about treating guests properly. The only difference is that now, we understand xenia in the same way that the people of that time period understood xenia. The knowledge of that concept makes all the difference. What this entire thing means is that you can #8217;t take the Bible at face value. Most people who preach it don #8217;t truly understand its meaning because they don #8217;t understand the culture surrounding it - they only understand their own culture. Which is natural, of course. But still a problem when it comes to situations like this. Before you simply say #8220;The Bible says all homosexuality of any kind is a sin #8221; you need to do the proper research surrounding each passage and understand its REAL meaning. This is also true for any portion of the Bible. Research is important because we don #8217;t know the culture surrounding the book.
Apologies for the spread of misinformation then. I didn #8217;t realize I was using outdated definitions. Thanks for updating me on them

On average, the ideal temperature for a woman is about 2 degrees cooler than the ideal temperature for a man (in F) due to the way that fat and muscle are distributed on the body. The problem that we encounter is that statistically speaking, most managers in an office space are slightly overweight, middle aged males who set the temperature to a level that they #8217;re comfortable at, which results in the temperature being less comfortable for women. Now normally, that wouldn #8217;t really be THAT big of a deal. But studies have shown that in environments like this, women suffer a significant decrease in productivity, around 21% if I #8217;m remembering correctly, though I admit I may be wrong about that number. However, in environments where the temperature is set to a comfortable level for the women, MEN suffer a decrease in productivity of around the same percentage. And when set to an acceptable level for both men and women, the decrease in productivity is significantly lessened on both sides. It has been scientifically proven that office air conditioning does have a direct effect on the productivity of men and women in the work place. WRITING.TEXT: I happen to work as a bar tender at an upscale joint and this was something that I observed pretty recently and found rather interesting. There was a group of gentlemen who were there for a business event and, naturally, started having a few cocktails. One man came up to the bar and asked that I get him a #8220;virgin Jack and Coke. #8221; For those who don #8217;t know the first thing about cocktails, that just means that he wants a alcohol free Jack and Coke, so... a just a Coke. I obliged him and put some Coke in a cocktail glass for him. He later explained that he #8217;d been sober for a good 20+ years and didn #8217;t want to relapse, but also didn #8217;t want to seem out of place with the other guys there. So, I suppose that all I #8217;m trying to say is if you don #8217;t want to drink, but you #8217;re with people who expect you to and don #8217;t want to explain your situation to them, then just use this little trick. It #8217;s pretty simple, but from what I saw, no one ever doubted the gentleman for a second.

Yeah man, of course. I get people in all the time who don #8217;t drink. This one instance was just interesting to me because it was a situation where a man was expected to drink and tricked everyone into believing that he was drinking.

Quick little fun fact about that verse and what it REALLY means. TL;DR - 1 Corinthians 6:9 is actually about taking advantage of and raping underage slave boys and also not doing your duty to society as a man. 1 Corinthians 6:9 translates very poorly from Ancient Greek. But it #8217;s generally agreed upon by most historians now that it doesn #8217;t say #8220;men who sleep with men. #8221; Instead, it references underaged slave boys. There are two words that are often misinterpreted from this little passage. The first is #8220;Malakoi #8221; which doesn #8217;t directly translate into English, but generally is used to describe a man to over indulges in feminine activities. As in, he fights poorly in battle, can #8217;t tolerate hard labor, or allows himself to be governed by emotion rather than reason. (Note: I acknowledge the sexist tones here. I #8217;m just explaining the Ancient Greek way of thinking and understanding of the word.) In the KJV, #8220;Malakoi #8221; is translated to #8220;effeminate. #8221; It isn #8217;t until much later that they change the translation to #8220;the sexually immoral. #8221; That is not the correct translation of the word. The second word is #8220;Arsenokoitai #8221; which didn #8217;t appear in language until after Paul wrote this letter. Simply put, it #8217;s a word that Paul made up. In the modern world, it #8217;s generally the word that gets translated to #8220;men who have sex with men. #8221; But again, this isn #8217;t that accurate. #8220;Arsen #8221; means #8220;male #8221; while #8220;Koites #8221; means #8220;bed. #8221; So the word most closely translates to #8220;male beds. #8221; That could carry a homosexual connotation to it, however there already exist several words in Ancient Greek to describe a man who has sex with men. And Paul was a very direct person in most of his writings. He didn #8217;t sugar coat things. So, if that were the problem, he likely would have directly mentioned homosexual men. Instead, you should understand sex as the Romans did before making assumptions. See, they didn #8217;t think in terms of heterosexual vs homosexual. They though in terms of power. The role of a freeborn Roman citizen was to penetrate. The role of a woman and of a slave was to be penetrated. To penetrate another person was to exert power over them. And it was common practice for Roman men to keep young boys around for exactly that purpose. They were essentially sex slaves and often referred to as #8220;bed keepers. #8221; So, when Paul condemns those who participate in #8220;male beds, #8221; it #8217;s highly likely that he #8217;s talking about the practice of keeping young boys as sex slaves. Not the sex between two consenting adults.

Apologies for taking so long to get back to you on this. Had a pretty busy weekend in the real world. Now, on to the actual argument at hand.\~\~\~ You're correct - Paul could have used much more direct and precise language. I openly admitted in my very first post that the use of the words "male beds" could, in fact, carry a homosexual connotation. gt;So the word most closely translates to #8220;male beds. #8221; That could carry a homosexual connotation to it Your next argument seems to be arguing against noting. For whatever reason, you seem to have made the assumption that I'm claiming that Christian culture is secretly 100% okay with homosexuality or that the Bible isn't homophobic. I can't stress this enough - ***THAT IS NOT WHAT I AM SAYING.*** If you would like to discuss the morality of the Bible, I ask that you please take that discussion somewhere else. I'm not here to talk about that. I'm here to talk about the meaning of the words used in this exact context. Instead, what I'm saying is that this specific verse (1 Corinthians 6;9) isn't nearly as direct and straightforward as the man in the picture (left) makes it out to be. He would have you believe that the English Standard translation is a direct translation when it reads as "the sexually immoral" and "men who practice homosexuality." It doesn't take my level of education to see that those two phrases are VERY different from the words "effeminate" and "male beds." If you refuse to acknowledge those differences, then that's entirely on you. Next, you seem a bit upset with me for revealing my actual credentials on this subject and accuse me of only valuing appeal to authority. I'd like to point out that you're the one who originally called my credentials into question by saying, gt;So I suppose you have a Greek Urban-dictionary in your pocket. Yeah, no... You questioned my knowledge on the subject at hand (in a very needlessly sarcastic way, might I add) and I answered you by explaining my level of education on the subject. Don't you dare try and fault me for that. As for Kevin DeYoung, let's break every aspect of this down. * His PhD is in early modern history, not any kind of language studies. While I acknowledge that he is qualified to discuss history, I would NOT trust him to translate Ancient Greek texts into English. Unless, of course, he has some other training that I'm unaware of. * I realize that this is a bit of an ad hominem, but he completed his undergrad at Gordon-Conwell Theological Seminary. I hate to say it, but I think it's safe to assume that his school of choice probably wasn't completely unbiased in its curriculum. * The article in question is a valid argument. I acknowledge that. But again, we see DeYoung's bias coming out when he makes the claim "there is no real other interpretation" I genuinely dislike any claim that there is only one possible way to understand a word. To be quite frank, that's bullshit. But my personal opinions aside, I gave a potential alternative interpretation that does make a lot of sense with the way that other writers of the time were describing young male slaves - "bed keepers." * If Paul were directly pulling from Leviticus, why would he go out of his way to combine the two words rather than simply keeping them separate? If that's the case, then it's almost undoubtedly a misquote on Paul's part. Which, I again acknowledge as a possibility. However, based on your arguments, DeYoung's arguments, and my understanding of Paul as a person, it's very unlikely that Paul would misquote the Torah. \~\~\~ Ultimately, we can sit and speculate on what this verse says for hours on end. But I'm telling you, factually, that it **does not say** "the sexually immoral" nor does it say "men who practice homosexuality." If you, or anyone else, chooses to believe in that *interpretation*, then I can't and won't stop you. But you can't accept that *translation*. I'm not trying to tell you (or anyone else) what you should and shouldn't believe. I'm simply trying to offer you a better translation and some added context so that you can have a better understand of the real meaning of the verse - whatever that meaning might be. Feel free to resent me for that as much as you like.
OP, I'm so sorry. I know the whole meaning behind this sub and as per the rules, this undoubtedly belongs here. But I just can't bring myself to upvote it.

At this point, we're only talking in circles so I'm going to keep this brief. The most direct translation of the words are "effeminate" and "male beds." The incorrect translations are "sexually immoral" and "men who practice homosexuality." That is my only point. Nothing else matters to me. If you want to talk about Christian history of homophobia, I literally couldn't care any less. I'm only translating this verse and explaining why it's far from being as straightforward as many Christians make it out to be. I'm explaining why it doesn't say "sexually immoral" or "men who practice homosexuality." I honestly don't know why you have a problem with that, but oh well. Here we are. Oh, and since you brought it up. gt;If asked about it, Paul would have clearly condemned homosexuality like any early Christian or Jew. We can't ask him. He's dead. So, we have to translate what he wrote and try to understand the meaning to the best of our abilities. Which is what I'm attempting to do here. Also, since you mention this point gt;the overall context is one of sexual repression and disgust for male homosexual relationships The entire point of this letter written by Paul is talking about Christians in Corinth getting into legal disputes, which Paul is vehemently against. This is the only time in this entire letter when he mentions anything even vaguely homoerotic. So if you want to know the real meaning behind 1 Corinthians, it can basically be boiled down to "Don't sue each other." I've made my point. I don't care how you choose to interpret the verse. I don't care about the history of Christian homophobia. I'm here to talk about translations. gt; Your arguments are side-steps from the real issue. That's incorrect. Your personal issues with the verse simply don't relate to my original argument. And until they do, I'm done trying to explain the definitions of words. Edit: I #8217;d also like to point out that the argument that Paul holds the same ideologies and sentiments as the majority of other early Christians is very false. A good portion of his writings are letters to other Christians in which he carefully explains why they #8217;re doing something wrong.
